| Section3 = {{Chembox Hazards Solubility = MainHazards = FlashPt =
| Autoignition =
  }} }} 'Adenosine monophosphate' ('AMP'), also known as '5'-adenylic acid', is
  a nucleotide that is used as a monomer in RNA. It is an ester of phosphoric
  acid and the nucleoside adenosine. AMP consists of a phosphate group, the
  sugar ribose, and the nucleobase adenine. As a substituent it takes the form
  of the prefix 'adenylyl-'.
